channel.title: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
channel.description:
Hi, I want to change max level on my PI source from 99 to 200. I know already that you can find it in player.java and playerassistant.java but if I change the value from 99 to 200 and check the training at level 136 it crashes. The level goes then to 136/0 it should be 136/136 and allow further traing but after that it remains stuck.
I hope some can help me, thanks.

item.title: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
item.dc:creator: @zamir88 zamir88
item.description:
@zamir88 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=zamir88 link=topic=475352.msg3479138#msg3479138 date=1295951045]

Just listen to I vain I
He know’s it.

Oh really? Smart boy read my post… I tried what he said
[/quote]You edited the combatLevel number, but not the formulas…[/quote]
Ok can you do it then? I don’t really know how to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]@OP; just modify the combat formula.

public int getCombatLevel() { int mag = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5); int ran = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5); int attstr = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]))); if (ran > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875)); } else if (mag > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875)); } else { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325)); } return combatLevel; }
All you would need to do is edit the multiplicants.

Then modify the XP method.

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 13034430) return 99; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; }[/quote]
Sorry but I don’t understand.
Sorry for being so stupid :’(

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200

item.title: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
item.dc:creator: @Dinoboy Dinoboy
item.description:
@Dinoboy wrote:

at around level 150 the experience is above the highest value an integer can represent. how will you represent levels above that in terms of experience? just keep it at the integer’s maximum value?

you COULD switch from sending experience as integers to sending them as longs which would require a lot of client and server editing.

and the other alternative is changing the level formula to accommodate for levels of 200 and experience less than the maximum value of an integer - it should still get progressively harder to level like it does in runescape.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200

item.title: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
item.dc:creator: @zamir88 zamir88
item.description:
@zamir88 wrote:

[quote=“Dinoboy, post:10, topic:379512”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=475352.msg3476098#msg3476098 date=1295719445]

the experience required to get to level 200 is above the maximum value for an integer anyways

You could also store it as a string.
[/quote]

it’s not so simple. first of all, a step up from an integer is a long, which is plenty sufficient, so a string is not needed. then, you have to send the experience a player has to the client. that would require a lot of editing. of course you could cap the experience a player sends to the client at let’s say, Integer.MAX_VALUE. that would stop showing experience for ~50 levels. then of course you could edit the formula but you need to make it so that it gets progressively harder but also stays under Integer.MAX_VALUE[/quote]
Kinda weird i’m sure it’s possible to work I saw it in old sources.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How to change max level from 99 to 200
